result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan J. Tijerina was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bryan J. Tijerina is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bryan J. Tijerina was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to 14CF1248.
Credit for 8 days, if revoked.
*****JOC IS AMENDED TO REFLECT 1 YR PROBATION *****

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with victims, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan J. Tijerina

from Janelle Nehring @ DOC
Left over Cash Bond from 14CF1248 to be applied to restitution in 16CF227 and the remainder to be applied to 15CF1073
Memo sent to Br 6 regarding bond and restitution
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Presentence Incarceration Credit - 8 days

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments made.   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years Consecutive to 14CF1248 with same conditions as the extended supervision in that case.  Credit for 8 days if revoked.  Court costs & surcharge to be paid during supervision and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given on record and Appeal Rights given and signed.
With Elizabeth/DDA Graveley and Atty Watson the SEH of 7/1/16 at 10am is rescheduled, as DDA Graveley is unavailable; reset to 7/21/16 at 3pm.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 7/1/16 at 10am.  Bond continued.
Kenosha County File 14CF1248

Demand for Discovery
Submitted by DDA Michael Graveley
Of bail/bond forf

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court enters judgment on bond forfeiture.  Case remains set for trial.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson needs time to review deft's new case.  STC continued to 3/31/16 at 8:15am.  Court revokes bond, issue of bond forfeiture to be addressed on 3/31.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson states the case may resolve, needs to meet w/deft to discuss the State's offer.  STC continued to 3/10/16 at 8:15am and JS 5/9/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

With Atty Watson and DDA Graveley the JSH of 1/22/16 at 8:15am is removed from the calendar as Atty Watson is unable to appear and the JS of 2/8/16 at 8:30am is changed to a STC at 8:15am, Atty Watson will be discussing offer w/deft.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DDA Graveley states the deft wants more time to consider the State's offer on both of his cases; states the parties agree that this case can be added to be tried with 14CF1248 on 2/8/16 if not resolved.  Atty Watson agrees.  JSH continued to 1/22/16 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
At the request of Atty Watson the FPT of 11/25/15 at 8:15am is rescheduled to 12/11/15 at 8:15am.
Per Atty Watson the deft was able to post bond so she is withdrawing her bond motion.

Defendant Bryan J. Tijerina appeared with Attorney Kristyne Alicen Watson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Michael David Graveley appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.
